Keywords: Celebrity , Spider-Man Family
Real Name: Gwen Stacy
Special Powers
ROLE TAG: Secret Identity
MOVEMENT: Elevated, Hindering
TARGETING: Characters
DIMENSIONAL TRAVEL WATCH: Ghost-Spider may start the game with [SVC] #s003 Dimensional Watch equipped (at no cost).
YOU DON'T GET TO LIKE MY HAIRCUT: When Ghost-Spider is given a MOVE action and moves 5 squares or less, after resolutions she may make an attack.

July 21, 2022
Itachi
So, the "new" (MAY 2021) ruling on replacement characters is that when the replacement is activated, it is "starting the game." Therefore, when you bring SVC037 Ghost-Spider in, she would have the watch. (Sidebar: the wording on the new "Call in Help From The Spider-Verse" is [almost] identical [apart from saying 'character name' instead of 'this character'] - "When this character hits an opposing character, if no character has been placed this turn, after resolutions you may roll a d6. 3-6: Place another friendly character with the Spider-Man Family keyword adjacent." I'm not 100% sure if they have released an errata to the old wording, "Once per turn for all characters with this trait, when 'this character' hits an opposing character, after actions resolve you may roll a d6 that can't be rerolled. 3-6: Place another friendly character with the Spider-Man Family keyword adjacent to this character.", but the new wording clarifies the whole "for all characters with this trait" verbage, which might be a bit counter-intuitive. Also note, both DW and the CIHFTSPV trait allow you to [B]attempt[/B] multiple times, e.g., Ghost-Spider hits, but fails to activate the Dimensional Watch; Miles hits, and succeeds on his CIHFTSPV roll, but after a character has been placed by Miles' effect, no other attempts could be made this turn.)
September 10, 2021
17wheeler
If you bring ghost spider in from your sideline via Gwen Stacy can ghost spider still use her travel watch trait?
October 7, 2020
mc268
This is a great dial, especially with the watch, phasing 5 and hitting 1-2 characters within 5 squares, 11 attack up top with prob, and the ability to move in a team mate if she hits. Her defensive values are good, and the prob can help her mitigate getting hit. Indom is always appreciated. Ignoring characters for targeting is pretty unique for her keywords, and she has a variety of team support between that, the watch, prob, perplex and TK. Her end dial is also pretty great with precision strike, hypersonic and perplex. All in all, a really great piece, if the fast forces version wasn’t so good I’d say this one is my favourite, but I’m torn. Still can’t get rid of the SFSM SR either. As a replacement for Gwen when KO’d she’s great, it’s a mini version of the main dial, why wouldn’t you take it?

Except she was never called Ghost-Spider in the movie, and the card says significant appearance: Ghost-Spider #1. So yeah this is comic Gwen. They just happened to use a movie quote.
